pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:5.1: 17. The training rule on swinging the arms
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were swinging their arms and resting them on supports while walking in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:7.1: “‘I will not swing my arms while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:8.1: Walking in an inhabited area, one should not swing one’s arms;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:8.2: one should walk keeping the arms steady.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:8.3: If a monk, out of disrespect, swings his arms and rests them on a support while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:9.2): if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:9.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:10.1: The seventh training rule is finished.
